comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~kashyapc

comments.content: notes from IRC. _sa_instance_state is from sqlalchemy. the stack trace happens when an object that is not a mapped object is passed somewhere to the ORM that expects it to be one (thanks to mdbooth and zzzeek)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content: looks like this was a transient failure.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content:
Well, I really despise closing bugs without a good rationale. 

But I'll probably live with it in this case since it's not reproducible as of now and "went away by itself", though Matthew Booth says this on #openstack-nova: "However, that doesn't seem like the sort of failure which should be transient.. Something returned an object of the wrong type. That's the sort of behaviour you hope would be deterministic".

Let's see if this manifests again.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~kashyapc

comments.content:
So, it looks like the error in the child cell would have been at least altered by change If5c19e5ac82ebdfaf973da388f9fbff516169d60. I haven't looked too closely, but at the very least I'd expect the stack trace to move into base.obj_to_primitive() from jsonutils.to_primitive(). It's possible this change resolved this issue.

As for the error in the region cell, it looks like something passed a dict to instance_update_at_top which contained a dependent object. It looks to me like it would only be possible to update fields with primitive types here.

At first glance, I think the 2 traces aren't directly related, btw. I'd also expect the failures to be deterministic, which is slightly worrying.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mbooth-9
